title: SMTP Client Module
description:
SMTP_CLIENT is used to send of classic emails.

Following features are supported:

SMTP protocol

Extended SMTP protocol

Sending the subject line, text and content

Indication of email sender address (From:), including "Display Name"

Indication of the recipient (s) (To:)

Indication of carbon copy recipient (s) (Cc:)

Indication of blind copy recipient (s) (bc:)

Sending fle (s) as an attachment

Authentication method: NO, PLAIN, LOGIN, CRAM-MD5

Specifying the port number

When positive edge at ACTIVATE the transfer process is started. The 

SERVER parameter contains the name of the SMTP server and optionally 

the user name and password and a port number. If you pass a user name 

and password, the procedure is according to standard SMTP.

124 Version 1.21

Chapter 9. Network and Communication

SERVER: URL
name: SMTP_CLIENT

input.name: SERVER
input.description: URL of the SMTP server, can include username, password, and port number.

input.name: MAIL FROM
input.description: The return address for the email.

input.name: MAILTO
input.description: Recipient addresses, can include To, Cc, Bc addresses separated by '#' and ';'.

input.name: SUBJECT
input.description: The subject text for the email.

input.name: FILES
input.description: List of files to be attached to the email. Multiple files separated by ';'.

input.name: ACTIVATE
input.description: Positive edge starts the email transfer process.

input.name: TIMEOUT
input.description: Timeout duration for the transfer process.

input.name: DTI_OFFSET
input.description: Time zone offset from UTC in minutes.

input.name: Dns_ip4
input.description: IP4 address of the DNS server.

output.name: DONE
output.description: Indicates whether the email transfer completed without error.

output.name: BUSY
output.description: Indicates whether the transfer is currently active.

output.name: ERROR_C
output.description: Error code associated with the transfer process.

output.name: ERROR_T
output.description: Problem type or identifier for the error that occurred.
